provenance.evidence_text: Then she did another work called Shoe Field

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Person collaborating with another Person (identified by role).
reasons.epistemic_stance: Knowledge of the production process of the work.

provenance.evidence_text: she worked with a programmer

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Person influencing Person.

provenance.evidence_text: she was influential in my life

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Person employed by Organisation.

provenance.evidence_text: Mark Bernstein (chief Scientist at Eastgate

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Organisation publishing Work/Genre.

provenance.evidence_text: Eastgate, one of the leading publishers of hypertext

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Person collaborating with a Group.

provenance.evidence_text: He was working with the hypertext community

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Person created Software (implied by context that Bernstein acquired it from him).

provenance.evidence_text: He picked up Storyspace from Michael Joyce

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Person distributing Software.

provenance.evidence_text: made it publicly available

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Judy Malloy is the addressee 'you'; Full Professor is a Role.
reasons.relation: Interviewer asserts Judy did not obtain this position.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Interviewer states this as a known fact regarding Judy's career history.

provenance.evidence_text: didn't get a full professorial post

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Judy Malloy is the speaker; Teaching is an Activity.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Speaker expresses desire to continue an existing activity.

provenance.evidence_text: I would love to continue teaching.

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Speaker is Person; Visiting Lecturer is a Role.
reasons.relation: Explicit statement of holding a job/role.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Firsthand account of recent employment ('just had').

provenance.evidence_text: I just had a wonderful 2 year visiting lecturer job

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Princeton resolved to University (Organisation).

provenance.evidence_text: job at Princeton

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Dual-career is a professional practice/methodology.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Reflecting on past personal experience ('When I was younger').

provenance.evidence_text: accepted the dual-career situation

reasons.sub_obj_classes: T.S. Eliot is a Person; Bank is an Organisation.

provenance.evidence_text: TS Eliot, worked at a bank

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Nathaniel Hawthorne is a Person; Customs House is an Organisation.

provenance.evidence_text: Nathaniel Hawthorne worked at a customs house

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Philip Larkin is a known poet (Actor/Person); Library is a workplace (Organisation).
reasons.relation: The text explicitly states he 'worked in' a library.
reasons.epistemic_stance: The speaker frames this as a question seeking confirmation ('didn't he?'), implying high probability based on general knowledge.

provenance.evidence_text: Philip Larkin worked in a library, didn't he?

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Speaker 'I' is Judy Malloy; Object is 'Libraries' mentioned in previous clause.
reasons.relation: Context implies employment ('the work is interesting', 'midcareer stage').
reasons.epistemic_stance: Speaker is recalling her own past feelings and career stage.

provenance.evidence_text: Libraries, particularly, are lovely... I was not unhappy with that at all, you know, when I was in midcareer stage.

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Speaker identifies herself with a specific role.
reasons.relation: Explicit statement of role 'as a single parent'.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Personal history recounted by the speaker.

provenance.evidence_text: Although occasionally, as a single parent, I was juggling an awful lot

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Actor interacting with a Group (Students).
reasons.relation: 'Working with students' and 'pass on to students' implies mentorship/supervision in an academic context.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Speaker describes current/recent feelings and activities ('until recently', 'thrilled to be').

provenance.evidence_text: I'm so thrilled to be working with students

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Speaker is an Actor; Electronic literature is a FieldOfStudy/Discipline.
reasons.relation: The metaphor 'have torches in' implies active engagement/work within the field.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Speaker asserts her position within the field.

provenance.evidence_text: we all have different torches in electronic literature

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Speaker is a Person; Computer is Hardware.

provenance.evidence_text: I mean, when I started using a computer to do my work in 1986

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Both are treated as fields/disciplines in the text.
reasons.relation: Speaker describes a movement of one field into another; 'mergedWith' is the closest schema property, though 'convergesWith' might be more precise.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Speaker expresses wonder/concern about a current trend.

provenance.evidence_text: I wonder about recent moves to take electronic literature into the field of multimedia

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Both are described as communities (Groups).
reasons.relation: The hostility is cited as a reason for the EL community's direction, implying influence.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Explicitly stated as 'someone implied to me'.

provenance.evidence_text: I mean someone implied to me that one reason why the electronic literature community is going in that direction is hostility from the literary community.

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Community is a Group; Multimedia is the implied field (ResearchArea).
reasons.relation: The community is moving towards/engaging with the field of multimedia.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Based on the implication reported by the speaker.

provenance.evidence_text: the electronic literature community is going in that direction

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Works refers to creative output; Images are resources/media.
reasons.relation: The works are created using these elements.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Speaker is evaluating the quality of these works ('are very good').

provenance.evidence_text: works created with images and sound and video

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Works refers to creative output; Sound is a resource/medium.
reasons.relation: The works are created using these elements.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Speaker is evaluating the quality of these works.

provenance.evidence_text: works created with images and sound and video

reasons.sub_obj_classes: Works refers to creative output; Video is a resource/medium.
reasons.relation: The works are created using these elements.
reasons.epistemic_stance: Speaker is evaluating the quality of these works.

provenance.evidence_text: works created with images and sound and video
